      34             : /**
      35             :  * The basic labeled argument that parses a value.
      36             :  * This is a template class, which means the type T defines the type
      37             :  * that a given object will attempt to parse when the flag/name is matched
      38             :  * on the command line.  While there is nothing stopping you from creating
      39             :  * an unflagged ValueArg, it is unwise and would cause significant problems.
      40             :  * Instead use an UnlabeledValueArg.
      41             :  */
      42             : template<class T>

      50             :          * is defined.
      51             :          */
      52             :         T _value;
